intro: Rytidosperma subulatum, commonly known as the slender spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, needle-like leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of short, stiff hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale blue flowers. It is well adapted to arid and coastal environments, often growing in sandy soils. Rytidosperma subulatum is an important component of the vegetation in its native range, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
